title: 1115-G2
statement: G2. OR oracletime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputImplement a quantum oracle on $$$N$$$ qubits which implements the following function: $$$$$$f(\\vec{x}) = x_0 \\vee x_1 \\vee \\dotsb \\vee x_{N-1}$$$$$$You have to implement an operation which takes the following inputs:an array of $$$N$$$ ($$$1 \\le N \\le 8$$$) qubits $$$x$$$ in an arbitrary state (input register),a qubit $$$y$$$ in an arbitrary state (output qubit),and performs a transformation $$$|x\\rangle|y\\rangle \\rightarrow |x\\rangle|y \\oplus f(x)\\rangle$$$. The operation doesn't have an output; its "output" is the state in which it leaves the qubits.Your code should have the following signature:namespace Solution {open Microsoft.Quantum.Primitive;open Microsoft.Quantum.Canon;operation Solve (x : Qubit[], y : Qubit) : Unit {body (...) {// your code here}adjoint auto;}}

processed.result:
You are given a set of $N$ qubits ($1 \le N \le 8$) and a single additional qubit.  You need to write a quantum operation that takes these qubits as input and performs the following:

1.  **Input:**  
    *   $N$ qubits in an arbitrary state, represented as $x_0, x_1, ..., x_{N-1}$
    *   One additional qubit in an arbitrary state, represented as $y$

2.  **Output:**  
    *   The same $N$ qubits in an unknown state.
    *   The additional qubit will be in a state of $y \oplus f(x)$, where $f(x) = x_0 \vee x_1 \vee ... \vee x_{N-1}$ (this is the logical OR of all the input qubits).

The operation does not return any output; it directly modifies the state of the qubits.
You need to write a program that takes a set of qubits and a single qubit as input. The program should modify the single qubit based on whether any of the qubits in the set are in a specific state.
